title: Corporate America’s Newest Activist Investor: Donald Trump
summary: The president is demanding government stakes in U.S. companies and cuts of their revenue. Experts see some similarities to state-managed capitalism in other parts of the world.

title: Intel's Downfall Underlines How Even Tech Giants Can Fade
summary: The Silicon Valley chipmaker’s journey from icon to a government project, with the sale of a 10 percent stake to the Trump administration, underlines how even the mightiest in tech can fall.

title: Lisa Cook, Who Broke Ground at the Fed, Faces Attack by Trump
summary: The first Black woman to serve on the Federal Reserve board, Ms. Cook has long been a pathbreaker in a field dominated by white men.

title: In Trump’s Second Term, Far-Right Agenda Enters the Mainstream
summary: President Trump has embraced an array of far-right views and talking points in ways that have delighted many right-wing activists who have long supported those ideas.

title: What Counts as a ‘National Emergency’?
summary: In his seven months back in office, President Trump has declared nine national emergencies, plus a “crime emergency” in Washington. Those emergency declarations have been used to justify hundreds of actions — including immigration measures, sweeping tariffs and energy deregulation — that would typically require congressional approval or lengthy regulatory review, according to a New York Times analysis of presidential documents.

title: Abrego Garcia’s Lawyers Say U.S. Officials Tried to Use Uganda Deportation Threat to ‘Coerce’ Guilty Plea
summary: Officials dangled an offer to send Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia to Costa Rica if he pleaded guilty to criminal charges, the lawyers said in a filing, then threatened to send him to Uganda if he did not.

title: After Gaza Famine Report, U.S. Is Mostly Silent and Israel Defiant
summary: The White House has not commented on a report finding famine in Gaza. Analysts say that absent U.S. pressure, Israel is unlikely to change course.

title: 5 Takeaways From Ghislaine Maxwell’s Interview About Jeffrey Epstein
summary: In a courthouse interview with the deputy attorney general, Ms. Maxwell, who has been convicted of sex trafficking, maintained that President Trump and other famous figures were not involved.

title: Can Redesigns of Wagner Park and East River Park Save Lower Manhattan?
summary: Two new parks fortifying the city’s coastline survived a bureaucratic gantlet that reveals why progress so often feels stuck.

title: Where U.S. Medicines Are Made and How Trump’s Tariffs Could Affect Them
summary: President Trump’s planned pharmaceutical tariffs threaten to hit many of the most common and well-known drugs that Americans take.

title: Faced With Trump’s English Mandate, Mexico’s Truckers Report to Class
summary: Companies, fearing penalties that could put them out of business, race to make sure their drivers have enough English to communicate with U.S. officials.

title: What to Know About the Menendez Brothers’ Parole Hearings
summary: In two hearings, California parole panels said the brothers should not be released from prison 36 years after they killed their parents.

title: Texas Legislature Gives Final Approval to Redistricting Map Favoring Republicans
summary: The map’s passage was a major victory in President Trump’s push to get Republican state leaders to help his party keep control of the U.S. House.

title: How Redistricting Wars Could Give the G.O.P. Up to 7 Seats
summary: As a handful of states have made moves and begun discussing redrawing their maps, here’s what’s at stake.

title: The White House Wants Indiana to Redistrict. Republicans There Are Split.
summary: As President Trump asks Republican-led states to redraw congressional maps, some Indiana conservatives are pushing back. “They should leave it alone,” one legislator said.

title: Harvard Is Making Changes Trump Officials Want, Even Without a Deal
summary: Harvard has sued, fighting the Trump administration’s demands. But the university has also enacted a host of items on the White House wish list.

title: Green Funerals Are Becoming a Popular Choice for Environmentally Conscious Americans
summary: More Americans are choosing burials in which everything is biodegradable.

title: What to Know About Student Loan Repayment Plan Changes and Your Options
summary: Federal student loans have been upended by litigation and legislation. Here’s what you need to know to repay your loans, avoid tax bombs and more.

title: Red Lobster Is Betting on Black Diners With Its Brand Comeback
summary: Are nostalgia, a new chief executive and seafood boil bags enough to save the seafood chain after more than 60 years?

title: John Bolton, Trump and the Crisis of Trust in Federal Law Enforcement
summary: If the F.B.I. is seen as a tool of retribution, it will come at the expense of its effectiveness in the long run.

title: Clemency Is Broken. That Keeps Me Employed.
summary: One filmmaker’s playbook for helping people get clemency.

title: The Water Cure
summary: Whether you swim furiously or float motionless, being in the water is a magical feeling.

title: Book Club: Read ‘Pride and Prejudice,’ by Jane Austen, With the Book Review
summary: In September, the Book Review Book Club will read and discuss Jane Austen’s classic, about the tortured romance of two people frazzled by miscommunications and assumptions.

title: The All-Female Hacker House Trying to Break A.I.’s Glass Ceiling
summary: FoundHer House, a home in San Francisco’s Glen Park neighborhood, is the rare all-female hacker house where residents are creating a supportive community to build their start-ups.

title: Iran’s Evin Prison Is Holding Dissidents Again
summary: Israel largely destroyed Evin prison, one of Iran’s most infamous symbols of oppression, in June. Less than two months later, Iran began returning male prisoners.

title: Rising Cost of a Day at the Beach Angers Italians
summary: For Americans, the price of eggs became a rallying cry for consumers beaten down by high prices. For Italians, it’s the cost of beach umbrellas.
